message: Does anyone know about a good (maybe even free?) alternative (good as in: good API, easy to integrate into django) to Akismet? I think their prices are absurd and a pure rip-off. Adding a captcha would not be preferred since that will only annoy the user..
have you looked at typepad antispam? http://antispam.typepad.com/ – haven't used it for a while but it used to be a free alternative to akismet

Just remember that Akismet uses the "hive mind" to build its spam db. It's so incredibly effective because more than 10% of the internet now runs on WordPress, so there are literally millions of people out there identifying spam signatures. A free or cheaper alternative would have to be very very popular to become as effective as Akismet.
Also, you can still get a free Akismet key by creating a username (not a blog) at wordpress.com - you don't strictly need to buy a license through akismet.com.
If you need something standalone, SpamBayes is both one of the granddaddy spam filters and has a decent Python API.
You could check out http://mollom.com/ which is from the guy behind drupal.
hmm seems as if all spam services are at the same crazy price range...
TypePad looks promising... I wonder why there are free and claim to be better than Akismet, having even the same API...
Crazy and clunky idea: route the form contents through a gmail account. Won't be instantaneous, but their spam algorithm is good and free.
@jeffrey maybe that target can just render an explanation to those few with js turned off about why/how they got there
but isn't that spam industry a multi-million dollar industry? These guys must know how to write bots that can process javascript on page load. Even *I* know how to do it...

They could process scripting, but most of the time they focus on the low hanging fruit and don't. I filter out most of my spam by adding an extra field that's hidden by CSS. If that field is submitted with a value, I just show the user or bot the normal response page without actually processing the form.

I added the following features to contact form to prevent spam: the post of the form must be from the same ip address as the get, the form contains a unique id that must be posted back (posted id must be valid and only submitted once), post and get must be within an hour and less than a few seconds apart, honeypot hidden form field that must not have any value in it. That wasn't enough, I still got spam.

Much more interesting option: Look at Cloudflare (www.cloudflare.com). They're a wicked clever proxying service, one of whose features is to challenge spammy behaviour. Totally free, interesting CDN services, and utterly fascinating.

a friend added a dummy form that was hidden using CSS. Pointing to a view that collects data like ip and subsequently blocked those IP for a while. That form was the first form in the HTML. A lot of the bots picked up that form and left the real one alone. Mind you that was a couple of years.
